column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$"My doctor put me on this to help me sleep. He said this is like seroquel on high. He told me to take this with Benadryl. I was really confused by this
column3: but I did it anyways. First night was great fell asleep in 15 minutes. I didn’t like my whole mouth going numb though. I woke up the next morning feeling great. I didn’t feel tired or drugged out for the first time in a long time. I didn’t take a nap all day either. The next night I tried taking it without the Benadryl
column4: and things didn’t go well. I didn’t get sleepy at all and I waited an hour. Then I went ahead and took the Benadryl and went to bed. The next day I still felt good. A on going problem I started having was my hands and feet would start to go numb out of nowhere. It would like 15 to 30 minutes. Then on the 3rd and final day I woke up with the driest mouth ever! I thought I will just drink some water
column5: and I will be good. That was not what happened. I chugged water all day long at work. Nothing helped. It felt like a desert in my mouth. I am no longer taking it. I can’t deal with all that. My doctor gave me something else to help me sleep I pick it up

column1: tomorrow. I am glad to hear that it has worked for a lot of you. "

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$3$3$no seide effects yet. however psychologist had put me on ziprasidone and i had a seizure and went to ER. The dr. on duty said it looked like i had mild stroke as well. I'v had seizures in the past maybe 5. Since i was on that med. i had a seizure and maybe a mini stroke. my blood pressure went down as well and dilantin levels were low. now she wanted me to start 80mg of ziprasidone luckily i didnt but was on 60mg for depression. Geodone was also a med she gave me which had side effects. Right now she has me on lamotrigine 25mg. Thats taken once aday in the afternoon. with that also im on Saphris of which helps me sleep but given as mood stablizer. My question is with my health problems. Are these two meds okay to take? Im a diabetic
column3: and take phenytoin to control seizures
column4: and metformin
column6: and asprin 325mgs for diabetes. i take oxycodone for fibromyalgia and arthritis every now and then and they are 5mg. Lisinopril 5mg i dont have high blood pressure but they give it to me so i dont have high blood pressure. im kind of afraid now to take new meds. the meds i take for diabetes i havent had any problems. what do you think? I need help because i dont think this psychologist isnt realizing whats happening. she says this all ok. I had side effects to her meds. I dont want to be a statistic to her meds.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$4$"i started taking this med and within 4 days i felt like i was a teenager again and started to clean my house and move furniture (that needs 2 people) and well i have been so low for about 8 years and could barely survive just feeding myself
column3: let alone clean . yet
column4: i have spent 2 weeks cleaning my house from top to bottom and were i have just about giving up on everything
column6: i have drive hell for 10 yrs with all the anti-depressants i DO NOT even want sex  except for maybe 3 times a year! i am in my prime in my late 30's and nothing with all the drugs. guys have all the help they need what about us? doctors give me nothing!  but now a month into this med. i want to tear a man apart.. i have drive
column7: i want more for my life!  i am not taking anybody's crap
column8: i am motivated to do what i haven't and to make up for lost time.  obviously i let my body go
column9: but now i am working on that too! it almost seems like i am manic except i sleep and very well.  I have taken steps to take my wants a little slower because i am not 18  so i am reminding myself that i have to ease into working out and big projects as a kid would have done with no thinking
column10: has anybody else had this energy and sex drive change?

column1: 87$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$7/5/2012 9:12:26 AM$Reviewer: Kirsten
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$The first time I took Saphris was the worst as it tasted foul
column3: but each time after that it got easier. It gives a slight tingling of the tongue and bitterness but at this stage I hardly notice it and it passes in less than 20 minutes. It is helping me so much to feel alert
column4: think clearly and sleep easily. Also I have found I eat less and am not as hungry as I was on Abilify and am finally losing weight again which I am really grateful for. I was suffering major depression and anxiety and combine Cymbalta with Saphris for these conditions. I can now honestly say I have no more symptoms of either condition and am truly delighted. It's definitely worth trying especially if you have found other antipsychotics to be a problem.

118$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$9/5/2011 1:29:32 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$4$Saphris has basically changed my life. I have been suffering with BP II for 22 years (heavy on the depression)

column3: awful-tasting pill has given me hope I've never had. I've been on it for about a year
column4: and it's still working. The only side effect I've had is tiredness. I take it before bed to minimize the effect

column1: 133$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/24/2011 3:01:44 PM$Reviewer: hervat76
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$I was taken off of Wellbutrin after having serious suicidal depression which led to hospitalization. The doctor at the hospital responsible for my med management put me on 5mg of Saphris at bedtime...no one checked on me until morning. All night I had body aches and couldn't walk when I got up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom. That morning with the nurse came to check my blood pressure I had 2 major seizurs which led to major memory loss and head trauma. Scary stuff....be careful if you decide to take this and make sure someone is monitoring you throughout the day and night that you first begin taking it.  Good luck. There are lots of good meds
column3: but this one is very new.

205$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$8/7/2010 4:08:49 AM$Reviewer: k895, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$3$Yes
column2: it tastes lousy.  Won’t lie there.   But having tried literally every other drug similar to this in the past 12 years
column3: I am getting the best results I have ever had with any of them.  And it is fairly weight-neutral - nothing a little extra time at the gym and some good food choices won't overcome.  NOTHING like the 40 pounds I put on in 8 weeks with Zyprexa.  Currently
column4: I take 10 mg of Saphris each night with 60 mg of Prozac each morning...and my depression is better than is has been in years (without being manic).

column1: My advice: just put up with the taste for 10 minutes.  It’s not that bad if you do it carefully…and I’d much rather have a bitter taste in my mouth followed by a little temporary numbness than the crazy weight gain I was getting from other atypical antipsychotics I was being prescribed for my treatment resistant depression (which has been argued to be Bipolar II Disorder...but really
column2: what does the specific diagnosis matter?  I was super depressed for a long time...and now I'm not).

column1: Now here’s the catch: my insurance is NOT covering this drug yet.  Luckily my psychiatrist has been giving me samples for like 6 months now.  Hope we can keep this arrangement up until this gets added to my insurance formulary (or we can successfully appeal the insurance company to cover it).  I really don’t want to go back to the way things were before I found this drug.
Every drug works differently for every person.  But if you have tried all the other options
column2: don’t be scared to try this one.  A bitter taste in your mouth is a small price to pay for what might be the right med choice for you.

column1: Oh
column2: and when I started taking the Saphris
column3: I started seeing positive results within my first week of taking it.  I wasn't “cured” overnight or anything like that
column4: but things started getting noticeably easier within the first few days of having this med.

column1: Good luck
column2: and don’t be scared to try it – it may be the wonder drug for you!  I know it was for me..."

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$1$5$"When I first started Saphris
column3: I thought it was a miracle drug. I was prescribed Saphris 2.5mg to boost the effects of my Lexapro 30mg. Within a day of taking my first dose of Saphris
column4: my depression lifted completely and I felt better than I had in years. Unfortunately I developed a Type 1 allergic reaction with wheezing
column7: incredible thirst and itching and had to stop Saphris after just a few days. Coming off of Saphris is no picnic. DO NOT drink alcohol while discontining Saphris - I had two glasses of wine one night and was so suicidal I almost drove to the hospital. Two days later
column8: I am having vivid nightmares and ""exploding head"" sensations and I still feel fragile and confused. I'm taking Claritin D and Pepcid AC to help with the puffiness and itchiness and I am still not comfortable. Can't wait to get this med out of my system."

column1: 271$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$10/5/2015 11:50:43 AM$Reviewer: Florida
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$2$OMG. This was among the most terrifying experiences of my life.  My doctor gave me sample to try to handle general depressing.  The side effects took 3 to 4 months to kick in and no benefit meanwhile.  The side effects were that my vision was so blurry that when I went to an optomitrist to she couldn't believe how fast my vision was detriorating as by the time the glasses were ready
column3: they had to be redone. She asked if I was on any new medications and this was when I finally figured it out. It left me with permanent eye sight damage months later!  To compound
column4: it has the effect of your handwriting getting smaller and smaller until you can't write!  Watch out for this stuff as if you're depressed
column5: it could cause you to totally lose your mind when you can't see or write to compound your situation!
